title: Planning, Conducting, and Reporting Responsible and Ethical Research
description: This course is designed to encourage inquiry of and discussion about regulations, ethical principles, and organizational practices that support the responsible and ethical conduct of research. These concepts will be conveyed using select readings, current events, student-led presentations, and invited guest speakers. Prerequisites: PH 40 or FMPH 40 and sophomore standing. This is a distance education course. Students may only receive credit for one of these courses: PH 151, PH 151R, or FMPH 151.
